definition: to do sth in batches or groups

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)

sentences.english: I heard that partial shipment wasnt permitted.
sentences.chinese: 我听说不允许分批装运。

sentences.english: Accounting systems that assemble costs in this fashion are called job order costing systems.
sentences.chinese: 这样的成本会计系统就叫分批法。

sentences.english: Please amend your L/C to allow partial shipment and transhipment.
sentences.chinese: 请修改你方信用证允许分批装运与转运。

sentences.english: The xylitol fermentation broth was carried out static state discoloring by using activated carbon.
sentences.chinese: 研究用活性碳对木糖醇发酵液的分批脱色。

sentences.english: After German unification, Soviet troops stationed in Germany starting from 1991, withdrew in groups.
sentences.chinese: 德国统一后，原驻德苏军从1991年开始分批撤离。

sentences.english: I batch the similar urgent tasks, then clear them at one go.
sentences.chinese: 我分批处理类似的紧急任务，然后一次处理完。

sentences.english: The technics conditions of batch fermentation were optimized by orthogonal test.
sentences.chinese: 通过正交试验，优化了分批发酵的最适工艺条件。

sentences.english: We deliver the money in mass or in instalments to the treasury.
sentences.chinese: 我们把钱整毛或分批送交金库。

sentences.english: Both of these two systems are widely used. We will describe the job order costing system first.
sentences.chinese: 这两种方法应用都很广泛，在此，我们先介绍分批法。

sentences.english: The prisoners were led out in batches and shot.
sentences.chinese: 这些囚犯被分批带出去枪毙了。

sentences.english: The retention bonuses are structured as a loan and deferred cash paid over three years.
sentences.chinese: 这笔留职金将在未来三年以现金方式分批支付。

sentences.english: The yield of acetic acid is high in the batch fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 应用于分批发酵试验产酸较高。

sentences.english: Would you accept delivery spread over a period of time?
sentences.chinese: 不知你们能在一段里分批交货？

sentences.english: Partial shipment or transshipment shall be permitted unless otherwise stated on the face hereof.
sentences.chinese: 应准许分批付运和转运，除非本合同正面另有规定。

sentences.english: Batch fermentation and fed-batch fermentation were carried out.
sentences.chinese: 进行了分批发酵和补料发酵。

sentences.english: In this thesis, the modeling and control of the penicillin fed-batchfermentation process were studied.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要研究青霉素补料分批发酵过程的建模与控制。

definition: to break up the whole into pieces (idiom); dealing with things one by one/divide and conquer
to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
to appoint a general (in theater)/fig. to appoint sb for a task
in turn/successively/one after the other/bit by bit
to assign (a task to different people)/to allocate
to snatch time/to rush/to hurry (up)/to seize the moment
